metadata.title: CVE-2024-26965 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: clk:qcom: mmcc-msm8974: fix terminating of frequency table arrays The frequencytable arrays are supposed to be terminated with an empty element. Add suchentry to the end of the arrays where it is missing in order to avoidpossible out-of-bound access when the table is traversed by functions likeqcom_find_freq() or qcom_find_freq_floor(). Only compile tested.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-26965` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-35-generic - 6.8.0-35.35
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-35-generic - 6.8.0-35.35
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-35-generic-64k - 6.8.0-35.35
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1009-aws - 6.8.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-azure - 6.8.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-gcp - 6.8.0-1008.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1004-gke - 6.8.0-1004.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1006-ibm - 6.8.0-1006.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-35-lowlatency - 6.8.0-35.35.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-35-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-35.35.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1006-oracle - 6.8.0-1006.6
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1006-oracle-64k - 6.8.0-1006.6
No subscription required

linux-image-6.8.0-1005-raspi - 6.8.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1006-oem - 6.8.0-1006.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-intel - 6.8.0-1005.12
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-35.35').

linux-azure package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1008.8').
